description.narrative: To support local government reforms, strengthen capacities of the governance architecture, policies, institutions and systems to effectively deliver inclusive services and sustainable local development in a responsive and accountable manner.

participating-org.narrative: Local Gov, Public Works, Nat H

description.narrative: Results Indicator 1.1 Percentage to which local government legislation and policies are aligned to the Constitution. Results Indicator 1.2: Development, enactment and implementation of the national local government policy and Rural Development Policy. Results Indicator 1.3: A Service Level Benchmark (SLB) framework in place and being used to evaluate the service delivery performance in the local government sector Results Indicator 1.4: A Service Delivery Monitoring and Evaluation Framework in placed and being utilised. Results Indicator 1.5: SDGs localisation framework in place and being implemented. Results Indicator 2.1: Enhanced skills and Competencies (financial management, governance, leadership) of professionals in the Local Government Sector Results Indicator 2.2: Enhanced Business processes and systems (financial, human resources, infrastructure) in Local Authorities Results Indicator 2.3: Local Economic Development Ventures Results Indicator 2.4: Efficient and Effective Revenue Collection and Generation in the local government sector Results Indicator 2.5: Piloting 3 alternative Service Delivery Models Results Indicator 3.1: Citizen Participation and Engagement Policy Results Indicator 3.2: Strengthened sub-national participatory structures (WARDCs, VIDCOs and Traditional Leadership) Results Indicator 4.1: Organisational Learning in the Local Government Sector Results Indicator 4.2: ICT Strategy Recommendations Implemented. Results Indicator 4.3: Two (2) Local Government Knowledge Institutions’ Capacity Enhanced Results Indicator 5.1: Gender Responsive Local Government Policy Results Indicator 5.2: Gender sensitive service delivery indicators Results Indicator 5.3: Gender Mainstreaming Capacity in the Local Government and responsible Ministries enhanced.

comment.narrative:
Result Indicator 1.1. Baseline (2016): There is no local government legislation aligned to the constitution. There are 30 pieces of legislation that need to be aligned. Result Indicator 1.2. There is no national Local Government Policy. Result Indicator 1.3 WASH sector service level benchmark for urban local authorities is in place. Result Indicator 1.4 There is no service delivery monitoring and evaluation framework. Result Indicator 1.5 There is no SDGs Localisation Framework.
Result Indicator 2.1. Capacity Assessment Report 2013 Result Indicator 2.2 Weak business processes and challenging easy of doing business context in the local government sector Result Indicator 2.3 There are limited LED interventions in local government Result Indicator 2.4 average 40% revenue collection efficiency Result Indicator 2.5 Few Initiatives on Alternative Service Delivery Models (TBA on specificities)
Result Indicator 3.1 No citizen participation and engagement policy Result Indicator 3.2 The capacity of the sub-national participatory planning structures is reported to be weak (TBA after the assessment)
Result Indicator 4.1 Limited organisational learning happening. Result Indicator 4.2 Limited use of ICT Result Indicator 4.3 TBA
Result Indicator 5.1 No gender responsive Local Government policy Result Indicator 5.2 There are no gender sensitive service delivery indicators Result Indicator 5.3 TBA

1.3. 32 Urban Local Authorities underwent the 2017 WASH Service Level Bench marking (SLB) Annual Peer Review process. A sample of 4 Local Authorities was reviewed and review reports produced. 2.1. The Councillors Induction Training Manuals were produced and a Training of Trainers (ToT) was carried to cascade the induction of 1958 Councillors following the 2018 Harmonised Elections held in July 2018; The 1958 newly elected local authorities Councillors were inducted and trained on the roles and responsibilities for discharging their mandates in the administration of Council business. The newly elected Councillors were equipped with reference tools such as Councillors Induction handbook and manuals that were developed to assist them in their oversight, policy making and representational work. 5.2. The gender sensitive service delivery indicators framework was not finalized during the review period due to the demanding electoral and newly elected Councillors induction processes.
